data.enText: to admit that you have been defeated and want to stop fighting; to allow yourself to be caught, taken prisoner, etc.
The rebel soldiers were forced to surrender.

data.chText: 劫机者最终向警方投降。
data.enText: The hijackers eventually surrendered themselves to the police.
to give up sth/sb when you are forced to

data.chText: 他同意放弃对那笔财产的一切权利要求。
data.enText: He agreed to surrender all claims to the property.
They surrendered their guns to the police.

data.chText: 被告被释放候审，但须交出护照。
data.enText: The defendant was released to await trial but had to surrender her passport.
surrender to sth
surrender yourself to sth

data.chText: 听任（感情、习惯等）摆布（或发展）
data.enText: to stop trying to prevent yourself from having a feeling, habit, etc. and allow it to control what you do

data.chText: 他最终克制不住，吸起毒来。
data.enText: He finally surrendered to his craving for drugs.
an act of admitting that you have been defeated and want to stop fighting
They demanded (an) unconditional surrender .
the fact of allowing yourself to be controlled by sth

data.chText: 他们指责政府唯工商界的利益是从。
data.enText: They accused the government of a surrender to business interests.

data.chText: （尤指在战争等过后）放弃，交出
data.enText: an act of giving sth to sb else even though you do not want to, especially after a battle, etc.

data.chText: 他们坚持要求立即交出全部武器。
data.enText: They insisted on the immediate surrender of all weapons.

simple_means.memory_skill: sur 下 + rend 给 + er 反复动作，连续动作；拟声动作 → 给出武器 → 投降

means: (尤指在战争等过后)放弃，交出

ex.enText: The soldiers vowed that they would rather die than surrender.

ex.chText: 我们决不会向邪恶势力低头。
ex.enText: We will never surrender to evil.

ex.chText: 在这种压力下，你能不屈服吗?
ex.enText: Couldn't you surrender under such pressure?

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指因战败而投降，或指在压力下屈服让步，常后接介词 to。

ex.enText: The rebels were forced to give in.

ex.chText: 他最后向妻子作出了让步。
ex.enText: Finally, he gave in to his wife.

ex.chText: 只有懦夫才向命运屈服。
ex.enText: Only a coward gives in to his fate.

synonyms.bx: 用法不如 surrender 正式，可后接介词 to。

ex.enText: They did not submit to the enemy.

ex.chText: 矿工们面对威胁，拒不低头。
ex.enText: The miners refused to submit to threats.

ex.chText: 你怎么能甘受这种虐待呢?
ex.enText: How could you submit to such ill treatment?

synonyms.bx: 通常指放弃抵抗，屈服于某一势力、权力、意志等。

ex.chText: 我们决不会向侵略者屈服。
ex.enText: We will never yield to invaders.
He didn't yield himself to his rival.

ex.chText: 我尊重法律，不会屈服于任何压力。
ex.enText: I won't yield to any pressure in my respect for the law.

synonyms.bx: 通常指放弃抵抗而投降，也可指因缺乏坚强的意志、忍耐力等而屈从于某种权势或压力，常后接介词 to。

data.enText: surrender to sth
surrender yourself to sth

data.chText: 听任（感情、习惯等）摆布（或发展）
data.enText: to stop trying to prevent yourself from having a feeling, habit, etc. and allow it to control what you do

data.chText: 他最终克制不住，吸起毒来。
data.enText: He finally surrendered to his craving for drugs.

tr: the act of surrendering (usually under agreed conditions)
example: they were protected until the capitulation of the fort

tr: the delivery of a principal into lawful custody
a verbal act of admitting defeat
give up or agree to forgo to the power or possession of another
example: The last Taleban fighters finally surrendered
The squatters had to surrender the building after the police moved in

value.def: If you surrender, you stop fighting or resisting someone and agree that you have been beaten.

example.ex: General Martin Bonnet called on the rebels to surrender...
example.tran: 马丁·邦尼特将军呼吁反叛者投降。

example.ex: She surrendered to the police in London last December.
example.tran: 她去年 12 月在伦敦向警方自首。

example.ex: ...the government's apparent surrender to demands made by the religious militants.
example.tran: 政府对宗教激进分子所提要求的明显妥协

value.def: If you surrender something you would rather keep, you give it up or let someone else have it, for example after a struggle.

example.ex: Nadja had to fill out forms surrendering all rights to her property...
example.tran: 纳佳不得不填表放弃其全部财产所有权。

example.ex: Gen. Morgan's troops yesterday surrendered their heavy weapons to Belgian and US troops.
example.tran: 昨天，摩根将军的部队被迫向比利时和美国军队交出了他们的重型武器。

example.ex: ...the sixteen-day deadline for the surrender of weapons and ammunition.
example.tran: 上缴武器和弹药的16天期限

value.def: If you surrender something such as a ticket or your passport, you give it to someone in authority when they ask you to.

example.ex: They have been ordered to surrender their passports.

value.def: You use surrender to refer to someone's attitude or behaviour when they lose the will to resist their feelings or the demands of other people.

example.ex: ...the need for total personal surrender to and dependence on Jesus...
example.tran: 需要完全顺从并依靠耶稣

example.ex: Depression is a partial surrender to death...
example.tran: 沮丧是对死亡的一定妥协。

example.ex: A look of disbelief came into his eyes, but was quickly replaced by one of dismal surrender.
example.tran: 他眼里闪现出一丝怀疑，但又马上代之以可怜无助的依从。

partsOfSpeech.dec: rend 给 + er 反复动作，连续动作；拟声动作 → 使成为；给予
rend 给 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 给予
sur 下 + rend 给 + er 反复动作，连续动作；拟声动作 → 给出武器 → 投降
sur 上；超；外加 + charge 收费 → 附加费
sur 上；超；外加 + face 脸面 → 表面
sur 上；超；外加 + feit〔 = fect做〕→ 做过了头 → 过量
sur 上；超；外加 + mount 山 → 登上；超越
sur 上；超；外加 + name 名字 → 姓
sur 上；超；外加 + pass 通过 → 超过
sur 上；超；外加 + plus 加 → 多余的
sur 上；超；外加 + real 真实的 → 超现实的
sur 上；超；外加 + realism 现实主义 → 超现实主义
sur 上；超；外加 + tax 税金 → 附加税
sur 下 + render 放弃 → 放弃；投降
sur 下 + round 圆圈 → 在下面围一圈 → 包围
surround + ing 表情况 → 周围的情况 → 环境
